name: The Pierre, A Taj Hotel, New York

reviews.title: One of the Best in New York
reviews.text: I just returned from a two night stay. I reserved a King Deluxe Room. Upon arrival I was greeted promptly, and escorted to the front desk. Even though check in was at 3pm, they had my room ready for me at noon. The staff is what makes this hotel so nice, they are genuine and care about the guests needs and requests. Rooms are classical style, with black and white marble baths. I was in room #1435 which didn't have much of a view, but it was quiet and immaculate. Turndown service was great, they go the extra mile to make sure you're room is turned down before you arrive back to the hotel. In short this is a great luxury hotel, very expensive at $500 a night, but if you have the cash, then a stay at the Pierre gives you the true New York experience.
Spent a night at the Pierre during business trip. My company had negotiated a 'discounted' rate for my room of $370 versus the usual $550. I just don't think it was worth it.
reviews.title: Not Good Enough
If you want elegance, excellent service and fantastic location...
reviews.text: OK, the room was large with a king-sized bed. But the bathroom needed updating and the free toiletries were minimal and unexciting. Where were the reams of fluffy towels, extra pillows and luxurious toiletries that make a hotel stay special instead of ordinary?
And at those prices, I really objected to the surcharge for broadband Internet access! I also hate the type of access where you have to sit at a desk to plug in, instead of broadband wireless.
reviews.title: Personal and Elegant...
Above Agerage
reviews.text: That said, front desk staff were extremely welcoming. Service in general not bad, but instead of paying people to hit the elevator buttons, upgrade the bathrooms and give guests free Internet!

We stayed at this hotel after our cruise and found it to be sadly in need of repair. Our bathroom leaked, marble tiles were cracked, and the bath tub had a coat of paint because it was so old and disgusting !
reviews.title: Run down and overpriced for what you are paying !
Nice but room sort of a let down
reviews.text: The room was small and the carpets were old and the furniture is cheap and worn. We couldn't believe that this was a five star hotel charging that kind amount of money. The food in the hotel was fine but expensive. The service was also fine. The hotel is well situated next to Central Park.

This place has totally gone to the dogs since Taj Group took over. While the place still looks nice from the outside, the little details are all gone. The carpets are dirty, there are dusty fake plants in the public bathrooms, fixtures that are chipped, chaulking that needs to be redone. They're cutting corners and prices are still high. The high tea service, for $42, advertises loose tea, but instead you get a tea bag in your tea pot, albeit a big tea bag, but still, it doesn't steep as well. Little things matter at this price point. Take you money and go to the Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental or some other luxury hotel where they know what they're doing.
reviews.title: old and tired, resting on its laurels

reviews.text: First of all, the stay we had at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park, in lieu of the Pierre, was outstanding.
